article.headline: Texas Southern 70, Prairie View 65
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Anthony Ike had 22 points and 11 rebounds to lead Texas Southern past Prairie View A&M 70-65 on Saturday night. The Tigers (4-12, 3-0 Southwestern Athletic) won their third straight after starting the season 1-12. Sollie Norwood scored 14 points, and Matthew Miller added 12, including four free throws in the final 17 seconds. Derek Johnson led Prairie View (2-13, 0-3) with 15 points, including a 3-pointer that pulled the Panthers within 64-63 with 26 seconds left before the Tigers clinched the game at the free-throw line. Brian Ezeh had 14 points for the Panthers, and Jacolby Satterwhite had 12 points and team highs of five steals and three assists. Texas Southern led 58-49 after a 3-pointer by Miller with 3:54 left, but Prairie View went on a 9-2 run to get within 62-60 at the 1:18 mark. On their next possession, the Panthers missed a layup that would have tied it and a 3-pointer that would have put them ahead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
